unnormalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Might Miss the Best Deals!
normalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Might Miss the Best Deals!

unnormalised: Hey everyone, ever been scrolling through your Instagram feed and BAM! A massive sale pops up, screaming "Limited time only!"? That's the magic (and madness!) of a flash sale, folks. In the world of retail and e-commerce, these short, intense promotions are like Diwali sales but lasting only for, say, 24 hours, or even just 2 hours!
normalised: Hey everyone, ever been scrolling through your Instagram feed and B A M! A massive sale pops up, screaming "Limited time only!"? That's the magic (and madness!) of a flash sale, folks. In the world of retail and e-commerce, these short, intense promotions are like Diwali sales but lasting only for, say, twenty four hours, or even just two hours!

unnormalised: Flash sales are designed to create a sense of urgency. Think about it: the FOMO is real! You see a beautiful Anarkali suit on Myntra, marked down by 70%, but the clock is ticking. What do you do? You probably add it to your cart faster than you can say "Navratri"!
normalised: Flash sales are designed to create a sense of urgency. Think about it: the F O M O is real! You see a beautiful Anarkali suit on Myntra, marked down by seventy percent, but the clock is ticking. What do you do? You probably add it to your cart faster than you can say "Navratri"!

unnormalised: For retailers, these sales are a fantastic way to clear out old inventory, boost sales figures quickly (perfect for impressing the investors at the next board meeting, right?), and attract new customers. Imagine a small business in Chandni Chowk, Delhi, with limited sq ft of storage space – a flash sale can be a lifesaver!

unnormalised: But for us, the consumers, there are a few things to keep in mind. Firstly, compare prices. That "70% off" sticker might be misleading if the original price was inflated. Secondly, check the return policy. You don't want to be stuck with a dud. And thirdly, be prepared! Have your payment information ready and know your size. No time to dilly-dally when the clock is ticking!

unnormalised: Just last week, my friend Priya missed out on a stunning saree from a local designer's online flash sale. She was too busy attending Dr. Sharma's seminar at IIT Madras and by the time she checked, it was all gone! Don't be a Priya!

unnormalised: So, next time you see that flash sale notification, take a deep breath, assess your needs, and happy shopping! Remember, responsible shopping is key. You don't want to end up with 5 new kurtas and an empty bank account, even if they were each only Rs. 500! Happy Hunting!
